recipe.title: How to Make Nikujaga
recipe.intro: Nikujaga is a Japanese meat and potato stew. It is sweet and warm, and very good for cold days.
recipe.ingredients: thin beef slices, potatoes, onion, carrot, soy sauce, sugar, mirin, water, cooking oil
steps: **Cut** the potatoes and carrot into big pieces.
**Heat** oil in a big pot and cook the beef.
**Add** the onion, potatoes, and carrot to the pot.
**Pour** water, soy sauce, sugar, and mirin into the pot.
**Cook** on low heat for 20 minutes until soft. **Enjoy!**

review.content: I went to Jasmine River Kitchen last Sunday. It was by the river in Southbank. The view of the water was so pretty. I sat at a table near the window. The nikujaga was very warm and sweet. The potatoes were so soft. It was like my mother's cooking. The restaurant was small and cozy. I saw pink flowers on each table. I want to go there again.

lines.speaker: A
lines.text: Hi! What are you cooking? It smells good!

lines.speaker: B
lines.text: Hi! I am making nikujaga. It is a Japanese stew.

lines.speaker: A
lines.text: Oh, it looks warm and nice.

lines.speaker: B
lines.text: Yes! It is sweet and salty. Do you want some?

lines.speaker: B
lines.text: Of course! Please wait ten minutes. It is almost ready.

lines.speaker: A
lines.text: Thank you! I love trying new food.

lines.speaker: B
lines.text: I am happy. This is my mother's recipe.

lines.speaker: A
lines.text: That is so nice. Your mother is a good cook!

lines.speaker: B
lines.text: Thank you! Please sit down. I will bring it to you.
